mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Favor of 13th received; regarding Mr. Tone's pamphlet he is averse to having private letters handed to public; only insipid sentiments will not cause contradiction; tranquility is summum bonum of his age; wishes to preserve it.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
Tone, William Theobald Wolfe, 1791-1828
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1819 August 2, Poplar Forest, [Bedford County, Virginia] to William Sampson, n.p.
